verses.verse: Now<WG1161> concerning<WG4012> the things whereof<WG3739> ye wrote<WG1125> unto me<WG3427>: It is good<WG2570> for a man<WG444> not<WG3361> to touch<WG680> a woman<WG1135>.

Nevertheless<WG1223> <WG1161>, to avoid fornication<WG4202>, let<WG2192> every man<WG1538> have<WG2192> his own<WG1438> wife<WG1135>, and<WG2532> let<WG2192> every woman<WG1538> have<WG2192> her own<WG2398> husband<WG435>.

The wife<WG1135> hath<WG1850> not<WG3756> power<WG1850> of her own<WG2398> body<WG4983>, but<WG235> the husband<WG435>: and<WG1161> likewise<WG3668> also<WG2532> the husband<WG435> hath<WG1850> not<WG3756> power<WG1850> of his own<WG2398> body<WG4983>, but<WG235> the wife<WG1135>.

Defraud ye<WG650> not<WG3361> one the other<WG240>, except<WG1509> <WG302> it be <WG5100> with<WG1537> consent<WG4859> for<WG4314> a time<WG2540>, that<WG2443> ye may give yourselves<WG4980> to fasting<WG3521> and<WG2532> prayer<WG4335>; and<WG2532> come<WG4905> together<WG1909> <WG846> again<WG3825>, that<WG3363> Satan<WG4567> tempt<WG3985> you<WG5209> not<WG3363> for<WG1223> your<WG5216> incontinency<WG192>.
But<WG1161> I speak<WG3004> this<WG5124> by<WG2596> permission<WG4774>, and not<WG3756> of<WG2596> commandment<WG2003>.

For<WG1063> I would<WG2309> that all<WG3956> men<WG444> were<WG1511> even<WG2532> as<WG5613> I myself<WG1683>. But<WG235> every man<WG1538> hath<WG2192> his proper<WG2398> gift<WG5486> of<WG1537> God<WG2316>, one<WG3739> <WG3303> after this manner<WG3779>, and<WG1161> another<WG3739> after that<WG3779>.
I say<WG3004> therefore<WG1161> to the unmarried<WG22> and<WG2532> widows<WG5503>, It is<WG2076> good<WG2570> for them<WG846> if<WG1437> they abide<WG3306> even<WG2504> as<WG5613> I<WG2504>.
But<WG1161> if<WG1487> they<WG1467> cannot<WG3756> contain<WG1467>, let them marry<WG1060>: for<WG1063> it is<WG2076> better<WG2909> to marry<WG1060> than<WG2228> to burn<WG4448>.
And<WG1161> unto the married<WG1060> I command<WG3853>, yet not<WG3756> I<WG1473>, but<WG235> the Lord<WG2962>, Let<WG5563> not<WG3361> the wife<WG1135> depart<WG5563> from<WG575> her husband<WG435>:

But<WG1161> and<WG2532> if<WG1437> she depart<WG5563>, let her remain<WG3306> unmarried<WG22>, or<WG2228> be reconciled<WG2644> to her husband<WG435>: and<WG2532> let<WG863> not<WG3361> the husband<WG435> put away<WG863> his wife<WG1135>.

But<WG1161> to the rest<WG3062> speak<WG3004> I<WG1473>, not<WG3756> the Lord<WG2962>: If any<WG1536> brother<WG80> hath<WG2192> a wife<WG1135> that believeth not<WG571>, and<WG2532> she<WG846> be pleased<WG4909> to dwell<WG3611> with<WG3326> him<WG846>, let him<WG863> not<WG3361> put<WG863> her<WG846> away<WG863>.

And<WG2532> the woman<WG1135> which<WG3748> hath<WG2192> an husband<WG435> that believeth not<WG571>, and<WG2532> if he<WG846> be pleased<WG4909> to dwell<WG3611> with<WG3326> her<WG846>, let her<WG863> not<WG3361> leave<WG863> him<WG846>.

For<WG1063> the unbelieving<WG571> husband<WG435> is sanctified<WG37> by<WG1722> the wife<WG1135>, and<WG2532> the unbelieving<WG571> wife<WG1135> is sanctified<WG37> by<WG1722> the husband<WG435>: else<WG686> <WG1893> were<WG2076> your<WG5216> children<WG5043> unclean<WG169>; but<WG1161> now<WG3568> are they<WG2076> holy<WG40>.

But<WG1161> if<WG1487> the unbelieving<WG571> depart<WG5563>, let him depart<WG5563>. A brother<WG80> or<WG2228> a sister<WG79> is<WG1402> not<WG3756> under bondage<WG1402> in<WG1722> such<WG5108> cases: but<WG1161> God<WG2316> hath called<WG2564> us<WG2248> to<WG1722> peace<WG1515>. to peace: Gr. in peace

For<WG1063> what<WG5101> knowest thou<WG1492>, O wife<WG1135>, whether<WG1487> thou shalt save<WG4982> thy husband<WG435>? or<WG2228> how<WG5101> knowest thou<WG1492>, O man<WG435>, whether<WG1487> thou shalt save<WG4982> thy wife<WG1135>? how: Gr. what

But<WG1508> as<WG5613> God<WG2316> hath distributed<WG3307> to every man<WG1538>, as<WG5613> the Lord<WG2962> hath called<WG2564> every one<WG1538>, so<WG3779> let him walk<WG4043>. And<WG2532> so<WG3779> ordain I<WG1299> in<WG1722> all<WG3956> churches<WG1577>.

Is<WG2564> any man<WG5100> called<WG2564> being circumcised<WG4059>? let him<WG1986> not<WG3361> become uncircumcised<WG1986>. Is<WG2564> any<WG5100> called<WG2564> in<WG1722> uncircumcision<WG203>? let him<WG4059> not<WG3361> be circumcised<WG4059>.
Circumcision<WG4061> is<WG2076> nothing<WG3762>, and<WG2532> uncircumcision<WG203> is<WG2076> nothing<WG3762>, but<WG235> the keeping<WG5084> of the commandments<WG1785> of God<WG2316>.
Let<WG3306> every man<WG1538> abide<WG3306> in<WG1722> the same<WG5026> calling<WG2821> wherein<WG1722> <WG3739> he was called<WG2564>.

Art thou called<WG2564> being a servant<WG1401>? care<WG3199> <WG4671> not<WG3361> for it<WG3199>: but<WG235> if<WG1499> thou mayest<WG1410> be made<WG1096> free<WG1658>, use<WG5530> it rather<WG3123>.

For<WG1063> he that is called<WG2564> in<WG1722> the Lord<WG2962>, being a servant<WG1401>, is<WG2076> the Lord's<WG2962> freeman<WG558>: likewise<WG3668> also<WG2532> he that is called<WG2564>, being free<WG1658>, is<WG2076> Christ's<WG5547> servant<WG1401>. freeman: Gr. made free
Ye are bought<WG59> with a price<WG5092>; be<WG1096> not<WG3361> ye<WG1096> the servants<WG1401> of men<WG444>.
Brethren<WG80>, let<WG3306> every man<WG1538>, wherein<WG1722> <WG3739> he is called<WG2564>, therein<WG1722> <WG5129> abide<WG3306> with<WG3844> God<WG2316>.

Now<WG1161> concerning<WG4012> virgins<WG3933> I have<WG2192> no<WG3756> commandment<WG2003> of the Lord<WG2962>: yet<WG1161> I give<WG1325> my judgment<WG1106>, as<WG5613> one that hath obtained mercy<WG1653> of<WG5259> the Lord<WG2962> to be<WG1511> faithful<WG4103>.

I suppose<WG3543> therefore<WG3767> that this<WG5124> is<WG5225> good<WG2570> for<WG1223> the present<WG1764> distress<WG318>, I say, that<WG3754> it is good<WG2570> for a man<WG444> so<WG3779> to be<WG1511>. distress: or, necessity
Art thou bound<WG1210> unto a wife<WG1135>? seek<WG2212> not<WG3361> to be loosed<WG3080>. Art thou loosed<WG3089> from<WG575> a wife<WG1135>? seek<WG2212> not<WG3361> a wife<WG1135>.

But<WG1161> and<WG2532> if<WG1437> thou marry<WG1060>, thou hast<WG264> not<WG3756> sinned<WG264>; and<WG2532> if<WG1437> a virgin<WG3933> marry<WG1060>, she hath<WG264> not<WG3756> sinned<WG264>. Nevertheless<WG1161> such<WG5108> shall have<WG2192> trouble<WG2347> in the flesh<WG4561>: but<WG1161> I<WG1473> spare<WG5339> you<WG5216>.

But<WG1161> this<WG5124> I say<WG5346>, brethren<WG80>, the time<WG2540> is short<WG4958>: it remaineth<WG2076> <WG3063>, that<WG2443> both<WG2532> they that have<WG2192> wives<WG1135> be<WG5600> as though<WG5613> they had<WG2192> none<WG3361>;

And<WG2532> they that weep<WG2799>, as<WG5613> though they wept<WG2799> not<WG3361>; and<WG2532> they that rejoice<WG5463>, as<WG5613> though they rejoiced<WG5463> not<WG3361>; and<WG2532> they that buy<WG59>, as<WG5613> though they possessed<WG2722> not<WG3361>;
And<WG2532> they that use<WG5530> this<WG5127> world<WG2889>, as<WG5613> not<WG3361> abusing<WG2710> it: for<WG1063> the fashion<WG4976> of this<WG5129> world<WG2889> passeth away<WG3855>.

But<WG1161> I would have<WG1511> <WG2309> you<WG5209> without carefulness<WG275>. He that is unmarried<WG22> careth<WG3309> for the things that belong to<WG3588> the Lord<WG2962>, how<WG4459> he may please<WG700> the Lord<WG2962>: that belong: Gr. of the Lord
But<WG1161> he that is married<WG1060> careth<WG3309> for the things that are<WG3588> of the world<WG2889>, how<WG4459> he may please<WG700> his wife<WG1135>.

There is difference also between<WG3307> a wife<WG1135> and<WG2532> a virgin<WG3933>. The unmarried woman<WG22> careth for<WG3309> the things<WG3588> of the Lord<WG2962>, that<WG2443> she may be<WG5600> holy<WG40> both<WG2532> in body<WG4983> and<WG2532> in spirit<WG4151>: but<WG1161> she that is married<WG1060> careth<WG3309> for the things<WG3588> of the world<WG2889>, how<WG4459> she may please<WG700> her husband<WG435>.

And<WG1161> this<WG5124> I speak<WG3004> for<WG4314> your<WG5216> own<WG846> profit<WG4851>; not<WG3756> that<WG2443> I may cast<WG1911> a snare<WG1029> upon you<WG5213>, but<WG235> for that which<WG4314> is comely<WG2158>, and<WG2532> that ye may attend upon<WG2145> the Lord<WG2962> without distraction<WG563>.

But<WG1161> if any man<WG1536> think<WG3543> that he behaveth himself uncomely<WG807> toward<WG1909> his<WG846> virgin<WG3933>, if<WG1437> she pass the flower of her age<WG5230> <WG5600>, and<WG2532> need<WG3784> so<WG3779> require<WG1096>, let him do<WG4160> what<WG3739> he will<WG2309>, he sinneth<WG264> not<WG3756>: let them marry<WG1060>.

Nevertheless<WG1161> he<WG3739> that standeth<WG2476> stedfast<WG1476> in<WG1722> his heart<WG2588>, having<WG2192> no<WG3361> necessity<WG318>, but<WG1161> hath<WG2192> power<WG1849> over<WG4012> his own<WG2398> will<WG2307>, and<WG2532> hath<WG2919> so<WG5124> decreed<WG2919> in<WG1722> his<WG846> heart<WG2588> that he will keep<WG5083> his<WG1438> virgin<WG3933>, doeth<WG4160> well<WG2573>.
So<WG5620> then<WG2532> he that giveth her in marriage<WG1547> doeth<WG4160> well<WG2573>; but<WG1161> he that giveth her <WG1547> not<WG3361> in marriage<WG1547> doeth<WG4160> better<WG2908>.

The wife<WG1135> is bound<WG1210> by the law<WG3551> <WG1909> as long<WG5550> as<WG3745> her<WG846> husband<WG435> liveth<WG2198>; but<WG1161> if<WG1437> her<WG846> husband<WG435> be dead<WG2837>, she is<WG2076> at liberty<WG1658> to be married<WG1060> to whom<WG3739> she will<WG2309>; only<WG3440> in<WG1722> the Lord<WG2962>.

But<WG1161> she is<WG2076> happier<WG3107> if<WG1437> she<WG3306> so<WG3779> abide<WG3306>, after<WG2596> my<WG1699> judgment<WG1106>: and<WG1161> I think<WG1380> also<WG2504> that I have<WG2192> the Spirit<WG4151> of God<WG2316>.
